newsitem.title: BOSNIA: U.S. defence secretary arrives in Bosnia.
newsitem.headline: U.S. defence secretary arrives in Bosnia.

text.p: U.S. Defence Secretary William Perry arrived in Bosnia on Thursday to visit American troops and hold talks with NATO officers about a new peace force scheduled for Bosnia next year.
Perry was greeted by U.S. army General George Joulwan, commander of NATO forces in Europe, and other senior U.S. officers at the start of a five-hour visit.
Later on this second day of a globe-circling trip, Perry was due to fly on to Kuwait.
While in Bosnia Perry was having a traditional Thanksgiving lunch of turkey with American, Russian and other troops at a nearby camp later and meeting Russian officers.
U.S. and Russian troops will form part of the new 31,000-strong peacekeeping force in Bosnia.
